meanings.sent1: The peculiar sound coming from the old house made me curious.
meanings.sent2: It was peculiar to see a cat chasing a dog instead of the other way around.
meanings.sent3: The peculiar hat the clown wore made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her peculiar behavior at the party raised some eyebrows.
meanings.sent5: The peculiar smell in the room lingered long after the party ended.

meanings.definition: Belonging exclusively to one person or group
meanings.sent1: The peculiar key only fit the lock in the attic.
meanings.sent2: The peculiar necklace was handed down through generations in the family.
meanings.sent3: His peculiar chair was off-limits to anyone else in the house.
meanings.sent4: The peculiar password granted access to the secret club.
meanings.sent5: The peculiar signature on the painting proved its authenticity.

meanings.definition: Characteristic of a particular person or thing
meanings.sent1: The peculiar scent reminded me of my grandmother's house.
meanings.sent2: The peculiar markings on the vase identified it as an ancient artifact.
meanings.sent3: Her peculiar laugh could be heard from across the room.
meanings.sent4: The peculiar design of the building made it stand out in the city.
meanings.sent5: The peculiar taste of the dish brought back memories of childhood.
